poem:
"Jury Instructions, With Dawn Beckoning"

Sunrise breaks over capitol's gray facade,
a courtroom's stillness tucked within lawyer's discourse.
Hushed whispers join the morning song, 
beneath the shadow of a figure relentless.
Testimonies fall like leaves, one chooses silence over sound.
Indeed, Tuesday calls the jury home -
To sift through truth, wrapped in testament,
To bestow justice as the sun dips low again.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The jury has been sent home and instructed to return next Tuesday. Here’s a recap of today’s developments: Trump declined to testify at his own criminal trial". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
